circle.c

00001 /* circle.c -- an example of a UI object with a transparent background, and movable foreground
00002 
00003     demonstrates use of a _clipregion function as a response to the 'clipregion' message
00004     also shows when and where to use of box_invalnow()
00005 
00006 */
00007 
00008 #include "ext.h"
00009 #include "ext_user.h"
00010 #include "ext_path.h"
00011 #include "ext_strings.h"
00012 #include "ext_common.h"
00013 //#include <Drag.h>
00014 
00015 #ifdef USE_QTML
00016 #include "ext_qtstubs.h"
00017 #endif
00018 
00019 #define RES_ID      3526        // resource ID for assistance string
00020 
00021 #define MAXWIDTH    1024        // maximum width and height of user object in pixels
00022 #define MAXHEIGHT   1024        //    (defines maximum offscreen canvas allocation)
00023 #define MINWIDTH    100         // minimum width and height
00024 #define MINHEIGHT   100         
00025 #define DEFWIDTH    200         // default box width and height
00026 #define DEFHEIGHT   100 
00027 #define C_CIRCSIZE 50
00028 #define C_CIRCLEFT 20
00029 #define C_CIRCTOP 20
00030 
00031 
00032 typedef struct circle
00033 {
00034     t_box c_box;            // UI object header
00035     Rect c_rect;            // for size change comparison
00036     void *c_qelem;          // queue element for redraw
00037     
00038     long c_xval;            // new x value
00039     long c_dxval;           // drawn x value
00040     long c_yval;            // new y value
00041     long c_dyval;           // drawn y value
00042     
00043     long c_size;            // new circle size
00044     long c_dsize;           // drawn circle size
00045     
00046     RGBColor c_frgb;        // circle color
00047     Boolean c_colorchange;  // has color changed?
00048     
00049 } t_circle;
00050 
00051 // some common colors we might find useful
00052 RGBColor myBlk = {0,0,0}, myRed = {65535,0,0};
00053 
00054 void circle_click(t_circle *x, Point pt, short modifiers);
00055 void circle_drag(t_circle *x, Point pt, short but);
00056 void circle_int(t_circle *x, long n);
00057 void circle_in1(t_circle *x, long n);
00058 void circle_in2(t_circle *x, long n);
00059 void circle_qfn(t_circle *x);
00060 
00061 RgnHandle circle_exclude(t_circle *x, Rect *r1, Rect *r2);
00062 void circle_frgb(t_circle *x, long red, long green, long blue);
00063 void circle_makerect(t_circle *x, Rect *r, long xval, long yval, long size);
00064 void circle_draw(t_circle *x, long xval, long yval, long size);
00065 void circle_update(t_circle *x);
00066 void circle_psave(t_circle *x, void *w);
00067 void circle_assist(t_circle *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s);
00068 void circle_free(t_circle *x);
00069 void *circle_new(t_symbol *s, short argc, t_atom *argv);
00070 void *circle_menu(void *p, long x, long y, long font);
00071 void circle_clipregion(t_circle *x, RgnHandle *rgn, short *result);
00072 
00073 t_symbol *ps_nothing;
00074 
00075 void *circle_class;
00076 
00077 void main(void)
00078 {
00079     setup((t_messlist **)&circle_class, (method)circle_new, (method)circle_free, (short)sizeof(t_circle), 
00080         (method)circle_menu, A_GIMME, 0);
00081     addint((method)circle_int);
00082     addinx((method)circle_in1, 1);
00083     addinx((method)circle_in2, 2);
00084     addmess((method)circle_frgb,    "frgb",     A_LONG, A_LONG, A_LONG, 0);
00085     addmess((method)circle_click,   "click",    A_CANT, 0);
00086     addmess((method)circle_update,  "update",   A_CANT, 0);
00087     addmess((method)circle_psave,   "psave",    A_CANT, 0);
00088     addmess((method)circle_assist,  "assist",   A_CANT, 0);
00089     addmess((method)circle_clipregion, "clipregion", A_CANT, 0); // defines non-rectangular clipping region
00090     
00091     rescopy(FOUR_CHAR_CODE('STR#'),RES_ID);
00092 }
00093 
00094 void circle_click(t_circle *x, Point pt, short modifiers)
00095 {
00096     RgnHandle rgn;
00097     short clipresult; // dummy
00098     Rect r = x->c_box.b_rect;
00099     short xval, yval, maxx, maxy;
00100     short size = x->c_size;
00101 
00102 #ifdef USE_QTML
00103     GrafPtr gp;
00104     gp = XQT_patcher_setport(x->c_box.b_patcher);
00105 #endif
00106 
00107     circle_clipregion(x, &rgn, &clipresult); // we call this method ourselves to get a region with our circle
00108     
00109     if (PtInRgn(pt,rgn)) { // only drag circle if we click directly on it!
00110     
00111         xval = pt.h - r.left - C_CIRCLEFT - (size/2); // click location represents the center of the circle
00112         yval = pt.v - r.top - C_CIRCTOP - (size/2);
00113         
00114         maxx = (r.right-r.left) - (C_CIRCLEFT*2) - size;
00115         maxy = (r.bottom-r.top) - (C_CIRCTOP*2) - size;
00116         
00117         x->c_xval = CLIP(xval, 0, maxx);
00118         x->c_yval = CLIP(yval, 0, maxy);
00119     
00120         qelem_set(x->c_qelem);
00121         wind_drag((void *)circle_drag, x, pt);
00122     }
00123     DisposeRgn(rgn); // we dispose of the region now that we're finished with it
00124 
00125 #ifdef USE_QTML
00126     XQT_patcher_restoreport(gp);
00127 #endif
00128 }
00129 
00130 void circle_drag(t_circle *x, Point pt, short but)
00131 {
00132     Rect r = x->c_box.b_rect;
00133     short xval, yval, maxx, maxy;
00134     short size = x->c_size;
00135     
00136     if (but) { // while mouse button is down
00137     
00138         xval = pt.h - r.left - C_CIRCLEFT - (size/2); // click location represents the center of the circle
00139         yval = pt.v - r.top - C_CIRCTOP - (size/2);
00140         
00141         maxx = (r.right-r.left) - (C_CIRCLEFT*2) - size;
00142         maxy = (r.bottom-r.top) - (C_CIRCTOP*2) - size;
00143         
00144         x->c_xval = CLIP(xval, 0, maxx);
00145         x->c_yval = CLIP(yval, 0, maxy);
00146     
00147         qelem_set(x->c_qelem);
00148     }
00149 }
00150 
00151 
00152 // the _clipregion method is used to define and create our object's clipping region
00153 //      i.e. the non-rectangular shape which will serve as the object's visual border
00154 void circle_clipregion(t_circle *x, RgnHandle *rgn, short *result)
00155 {
00156 #ifdef USE_QTML
00157     *result = CLIPRGN_EMPTY;
00158     return;
00159 #else       
00160     Rect r;
00161 
00162     circle_makerect(x,&r,x->c_dxval, x->c_dyval, x->c_dsize);
00163     OpenRgn();
00164     FrameOval(&r);
00165     CloseRgn(*rgn = NewRgn());  // we create a region in the RgnHandle we're given
00166     *result = CLIPRGN_REGION;   // we let Max know it's a region (as opposed to the box's rect)
00167 
00168     //  note that we do NOT dispose of the region here... 
00169     //      it is disposed by the calling function after the region is used
00170 #endif
00171 }
00172 
00173 void circle_int(t_circle *x, long n)
00174 {
00175     Rect r = x->c_box.b_rect;
00176     short maxval;
00177     
00178     maxval = (r.right-r.left) - (C_CIRCLEFT*2) - x->c_size;
00179     
00180     x->c_xval = CLIP(n, 0, maxval);
00181     qelem_set(x->c_qelem);
00182 }
00183 
00184 void circle_in1(t_circle *x, long n)
00185 {
00186     Rect r = x->c_box.b_rect;
00187     short maxval;
00188     
00189     maxval = (r.bottom-r.top) - (C_CIRCTOP*2) - x->c_size;
00190     
00191     x->c_yval = CLIP(n, 0, maxval);
00192     qelem_set(x->c_qelem);
00193 }
00194 
00195 void circle_in2(t_circle *x, long n)
00196 {
00197     Rect r = x->c_box.b_rect;
00198     short maxval, maxx, maxy;
00199     
00200     maxval = MIN( (r.right-r.left), (r.bottom-r.top) ) - (C_CIRCLEFT*2);
00201     x->c_size = CLIP(n, 5, maxval);
00202     
00203     // recalc x and y values in case new size might draw out of bounds
00204     maxx = (r.right-r.left) - (C_CIRCLEFT*2) - x->c_size;
00205     maxy = (r.bottom-r.top) - (C_CIRCTOP*2) - x->c_size;
00206     
00207     x->c_xval = CLIP(x->c_xval, 0, maxx);
00208     x->c_yval = CLIP(x->c_yval, 0, maxy);
00209     
00210     qelem_set(x->c_qelem);
00211 }
00212 
00213 void circle_qfn(t_circle *x)
00214 {
00215     GrafPtr gp;
00216     RgnHandle old, temp;
00217     Rect r1,r2;
00218     long oldxval, newxval, oldyval, newyval, oldsize, newsize;
00219         
00220 #ifdef USE_QTML
00221     gp = XQT_patcher_setport(x->c_box.b_patcher);
00222 #else
00223     gp = patcher_setport(x->c_box.b_patcher);
00224 #endif
00225     oldxval = x->c_dxval;
00226     newxval = x->c_xval;
00227     oldyval = x->c_dyval;
00228     newyval = x->c_yval;
00229     oldsize = x->c_dsize;
00230     newsize = x->c_size;
00231     
00232     if (gp) {
00233         // only redraw if it's necessary
00234         if ((oldxval != newxval) || (oldyval != newyval) || (oldsize != newsize) || x->c_colorchange) { 
00235 
00236 #ifdef USE_QTML
00237             if (!XQT_box_nodraw((t_box *)x)) {  // set patcher's cliprgn (considering circle's OLD position)
00238 #else
00239             if (!box_nodraw((t_box *)x)) {  // set patcher's cliprgn (considering circle's OLD position)
00240 #endif
00241                 circle_makerect(x,&r1,oldxval, oldyval, oldsize);
00242                 circle_makerect(x,&r2,newxval, newyval, newsize);
00243     
00244                 if (x->c_colorchange)
00245                     x->c_colorchange = false;
00246                 
00247                 // set our clipping region to take into consideration the old and new circles
00248                 old = circle_exclude(x,&r1,&r2);
00249                 
00250                 box_invalnow((t_box *)x);   // erase everything we need to make the background transparent
00251 
00252                 SetClip(old);
00253                 DisposeRgn(old);
00254             
00255 #ifdef USE_QTML
00256                 XQT_box_enddraw((t_box *)x);  // restore the previous clipregion
00257 #else
00258                 box_enddraw((t_box *)x);    // restore the previous clipregion
00259 #endif
00260             }
00261             
00262             x->c_dxval = newxval;           // now update the circle to its new horiz position
00263             x->c_dyval = newyval;           // update the circle to its new vert position
00264             x->c_dsize = newsize;           // update the circle's size
00265                 
00266 #ifdef USE_QTML
00267             if (!XQT_box_nodraw((t_box *)x)) {  // set patcher's cliprgn (considering circle's NEW position)
00268 #else
00269             if (!box_nodraw((t_box *)x)) {  // set patcher's cliprgn (considering circle's NEW position)
00270 #endif
00271                 circle_draw(x, newxval, newyval, newsize);  // redraw the circle
00272 #ifdef USE_QTML
00273                 XQT_box_enddraw((t_box *)x);    // restore the previous clipregion
00274 #else
00275                 box_enddraw((t_box *)x);    // restore the previous clipregion
00276 #endif
00277             }
00278         }
00279 #ifdef USE_QTML
00280         XQT_patcher_restoreport(gp);
00281 #else
00282         MacSetPort(gp);
00283 #endif
00284     }
00285 }
00286 
00287 // define a clipping region which includes any part of the old circle not covered by the new circle
00288 RgnHandle circle_exclude(t_circle *x, Rect *r1, Rect *r2)
00289 {
00290     RgnHandle old,circ1,circ2;
00291     
00292     GetClip(old = NewRgn());    // save current clipping region
00293 
00294     OpenRgn();
00295     FrameOval(r1);
00296     CloseRgn(circ1 = NewRgn()); // old circ location
00297 
00298     OpenRgn();
00299     FrameOval(r2);
00300     CloseRgn(circ2 = NewRgn()); // new circ location
00301     
00302     DiffRgn(circ1,circ2,circ2); // circ2 is now the part of the old circle area not covered by the new circle
00303     SectRgn(old,circ2,circ2);   // circ2 is now intersected with the current clipping region
00304     
00305     SetClip(circ2);             // set the clipping region to circ2 for box_invalnow
00306     
00307     DisposeRgn(circ2);
00308     DisposeRgn(circ1);
00309     
00310     return old;                 // return the old clipping region so we can restore it after box_invalnow
00311 }
00312 
00313 void circle_frgb(t_circle *x, long red, long green, long blue)
00314 {
00315     // rgb colors in 0-255 range correctly converted to 0-65535 range with multiplication by 257
00316     x->c_frgb.red = red *257;
00317     x->c_frgb.green = green *257;
00318     x->c_frgb.blue = blue *257;
00319     x->c_colorchange = true;
00320     qelem_set(x->c_qelem);
00321 }
00322 
00323 void circle_makerect(t_circle *x, Rect *r, long xval, long yval, long size)
00324 {
00325     r->left = x->c_box.b_rect.left + C_CIRCLEFT + xval;
00326     r->top = x->c_box.b_rect.top + C_CIRCTOP + yval;
00327     r->right = r->left + size;
00328     r->bottom = r->top + size;
00329 }
00330 
00331 void circle_draw(t_circle *x, long xval, long yval, long size)
00332 {
00333     Rect r;
00334     Pattern p28;
00335 
00336     circle_makerect(x,&r,xval, yval, size);
00337     RGBForeColor(&x->c_frgb);
00338     PaintOval(&r);
00339     RGBForeColor(&myBlk);
00340     
00341     // draw dotted border when patch is in edit mode
00342     if (!box_ownerlocked(&x->c_box)) {
00343 #ifndef USE_QTML
00344         GetIndPattern(&p28,sysPatListID,4);
00345         PenPat(&p28);       // gray actually
00346 #endif 
00347         MacFrameRect(&x->c_box.b_rect);
00348     }
00349     PenNormal();
00350 }
00351 
00352 void circle_update(t_circle *x)
00353 {
00354     Rect r;
00355     short maxsize, maxx, maxy;
00356     
00357     short ow = x->c_rect.right - x->c_rect.left;
00358     short oh = x->c_rect.bottom - x->c_rect.top;
00359     short nw = x->c_box.b_rect.right-x->c_box.b_rect.left;
00360     short nh = x->c_box.b_rect.bottom-x->c_box.b_rect.top;
00361     
00362 #ifdef USE_QTML
00363     GrafPtr gp;
00364     gp = XQT_patcher_setport(x->c_box.b_patcher);
00365 #endif
00366 
00367     // if the UI object's box has changed in size...
00368     if(nh != oh || nw != ow) {
00369         nw = CLIP(nw, MINWIDTH, MAXWIDTH);  // constrain to min and max size
00370         nh = CLIP(nh, MINHEIGHT, MAXHEIGHT);
00371         box_size(&x->c_box, nw, nh);        // resize the box
00372         x->c_rect = r =x->c_box.b_rect;     // store the new rect for future comparison
00373         
00374         // recalc size, x and y values in case circle might draw out of bounds in new object rect
00375         maxsize = MIN( (r.right-r.left), (r.bottom-r.top) ) - (C_CIRCLEFT*2);
00376         x->c_dsize = x->c_size = CLIP(x->c_dsize, 0, maxsize);
00377         
00378         maxx = (r.right-r.left) - (C_CIRCLEFT*2) - x->c_size;
00379         maxy = (r.bottom-r.top) - (C_CIRCTOP*2) - x->c_size;
00380         
00381         x->c_dxval = x->c_xval = CLIP(x->c_xval, 0, maxx);
00382         x->c_dyval = x->c_yval = CLIP(x->c_yval, 0, maxy);
00383     }
00384     
00385     circle_draw(x, x->c_dxval, x->c_dyval, x->c_dsize); // redraw the circle
00386 
00387 #ifdef USE_QTML
00388     XQT_patcher_restoreport(gp);
00389 #endif
00390 }
00391 
00392 void circle_psave(t_circle *x, void *w)
00393 {
00394     Rect r = x->c_box.b_rect;
00395     t_atom argv[16];
00396     short inc = 0;
00397 
00398     SETSYM(argv,gensym("#P"));
00399     if (x->c_box.b_hidden) {    // i.e. if it's hidden when the patcher is locked
00400         SETSYM(argv+1,gensym("hidden"));
00401         inc = 1;
00402     }
00403     SETSYM(argv+1+inc,gensym("user"));
00404     SETSYM(argv+2+inc,ob_sym(x));
00405     SETLONG(argv+3+inc,r.left);
00406     SETLONG(argv+4+inc,r.top);
00407     SETLONG(argv+5+inc,r.right);
00408     SETLONG(argv+6+inc,r.bottom);   
00409     
00410     // rgb colors in 0-65535 range correctly converted to 0-255 range with division by 257
00411     SETLONG(argv+7+inc,x->c_frgb.red/257);
00412     SETLONG(argv+8+inc,x->c_frgb.green/257);
00413     SETLONG(argv+9+inc,x->c_frgb.blue/257);
00414     binbuf_insert(w, 0, 10+inc, argv);
00415 }
00416 
00417 void circle_assist(t_circle *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s)
00418 {
00419     assist_string(RES_ID,m,a,1,1,s);
00420 }
00421 
00422 void circle_free(t_circle *x)
00423 {
00424     qelem_free(x->c_qelem);
00425     box_free((t_box *)x);
00426 }
00427 
00428 void *circle_new(t_symbol *s, short argc, t_atom *argv)
00429 {
00430     t_circle *x = (t_circle *)newobject(circle_class);
00431     void *patcher;
00432     short top,left,bottom,right, flags;
00433     
00434     patcher = argv[0].a_w.w_obj;
00435     left = argv[1].a_w.w_long;
00436     top = argv[2].a_w.w_long;
00437     right = argv[3].a_w.w_long;
00438     bottom = argv[4].a_w.w_long;
00439     
00440     // note the F_MOVING flag defining the UI object as having a non-fixed, non-rectangular shape
00441     flags = F_DRAWFIRSTIN | F_GROWBOTH | F_NODRAWBOX | F_TRANSPARENT | F_SAVVY | F_MOVING;
00442     box_new((t_box *)x, patcher, flags, left, top, right, bottom);
00443     x->c_box.b_firstin = x;
00444     
00445     intin(x, 2);
00446     intin(x, 1);
00447     
00448     if (argc > 5) {
00449         // restore rgb colors (0-255 range correctly converted to 0-65535 with multiplication by 257)
00450         x->c_frgb.red = argv[5].a_w.w_long*257;
00451         x->c_frgb.green = argv[6].a_w.w_long*257;
00452         x->c_frgb.blue = argv[7].a_w.w_long*257;
00453     }
00454     else 
00455         x->c_frgb = myRed; // older versions did not save their color with the patcher
00456     
00457     x->c_qelem = qelem_new(x,(method)circle_qfn);
00458     
00459     x->c_dxval = x->c_xval = 0;
00460     x->c_dyval = x->c_yval = 0;
00461     x->c_dsize = x->c_size = C_CIRCSIZE;
00462     x->c_colorchange = false;
00463     
00464     box_ready((t_box *)x);
00465     return x;
00466 }
00467 
00468 void *circle_menu(void *p, long x, long y, long font)
00469 {
00470     t_atom argv[16];
00471     
00472     SETOBJ(argv,p);
00473     SETLONG(argv+1,x);
00474     SETLONG(argv+2,y);
00475     SETLONG(argv+3,x + DEFWIDTH);
00476     SETLONG(argv+4,y + DEFHEIGHT);
00477     SETLONG(argv+5,255); // default color = red
00478     SETLONG(argv+6,0);
00479     SETLONG(argv+7,0);
00480 
00481     return circle_new(gensym("circle"), 8, argv);
00482 }
